subject: Add Task 14: Track task completion dates via git hooks
body:
This task will test the automated tasks.md -> tasks.json sync system.
The post-commit hook should automatically parse this new task and
add it to tasks.json.

Features to implement:
- Add completedDate field to Task model
- Store timestamp when task marked complete
- Display completion dates in UI
- Persist dates across commits

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Update dev data files
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Add Tasks tab to dev-stats with automatic sync from tasks.md
body:
Features:
- Created tasks.json data file with all current tasks
- Added Task and TaskSubtask types to models
- Added tasks actions, reducer, and selectors to NgRx store
- Added tasks effect to load tasks.json on init (dev mode only)
- Added Tasks tab to dev-stats component with:
  - Task cards showing title, status, subtasks, and location
  - Checkbox UI for subtasks with completed state
  - Styled task cards with status badges (pending/completed)
  - Scrollable container matching commits tab design
- Updated post-commit hook to automatically:
  - Parse tasks.md markdown format
  - Extract tasks, subtasks, locations
  - Calculate completion status from subtasks
  - Generate tasks.json in correct format

Now tasks.md is the source of truth - whenever you update it and commit,
the hook automatically syncs changes to tasks.json for the app to display.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

subject: Fix intersection observer with continuous threshold updates
body:
The previous fix compared stale intersection ratios. Now using an array of thresholds (0, 0.05, 0.1, ..., 1.0) to ensure the observer continuously updates intersection ratios as sections scroll into view. This ensures the most visible section is accurately detected and set as active.

dev-commits.json when isDevMode() cookie is true. Simplify DevStats component

Add cookie-based dev mode feature that displays recent git commits in a modal.
When isMannanDev=1 cookie is set, a stats icon appears in the bottom-left.
Clicking it shows the last 9 commits with hash links, subjects, authors, and dates.

Git pre-commit hook automatically updates dev-commits.json on each commit.

subject: Fix Esc command click closing modal
body:
Removed keyboard event dispatch from toggleCursors() to prevent
the modal from closing when clicking the Esc command.

The cursor visibility still works correctly because:
- NgRx state updates via toggleCursorsVisible action
- App component dispatches cursorsVisibilityChanged event
- cursor.js listens to that event and updates cursor display

Now clicking Esc in modal only toggles cursors, doesn't close modal.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Keep modal open when clicking commands except H
body:
Removed modal close from openChat() so clicking commands keeps
modal open. Only the H command closes the modal (via toggle).

Behavior:
- Click "/" - Opens chat, modal stays open
- Click "Esc" - Toggles cursors, modal stays open
- Click "H" - Closes modal (toggles modal state)

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Make commands clickable and track state in NgRx
body:
Changes:
1. Removed () around H in viewer stats text
2. Added NgRx state for cursorsVisible and commandsModalVisible
3. Made all commands in modal clickable to execute
4. Commands now dispatch keyboard events to trigger actions

State Management:
- Added cursorsVisible and commandsModalVisible to AppState
- Added toggleCursorsVisible and toggleCommandsModal actions
- Added selectors for both states
- Modal subscribes to NgRx state for visibility
- App component dispatches cursorsVisibilityChanged event

Modal Commands:
- / - Opens chat by dispatching keyboard event
- Esc - Toggles cursor visibility via NgRx + dispatches event
- H - Toggles modal visibility via NgRx

cursor.js Integration:
- Listens to cursorsVisibilityChanged event
- Syncs cursor display with NgRx state
- Maintains backwards compatibility with local toggleCursors

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

The (H) is styled with the same kbd element for consistency.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Keep viewer count consistent when cursors are hidden
body:
Before: Viewer count decreased when cursors hidden with ESC
After: Viewer count remains constant (shows total connected users)

Changes:
- updateActiveViewerCount() now uses cursors.size (line 173)
- Removed visibility check - counts all cursors regardless of display
- Removed updateActiveViewerCount() call from toggleCursors() (line 183)

The count only changes when users actually connect/disconnect, not when
they toggle visibility with ESC.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Remove CSS transition from local cursor for instant tracking
body:
The problem: CSS transition caused 100ms lag on local cursor
- Remote cursors: Keep transition for smooth network updates
- Local cursor: Remove transition for instant mouse following

Changes:
- Added 'local-cursor' class to own cursor (cursors.js:39)
- CSS rule removes transition from .local-cursor (cursors.js:351-353)
- Fixed initialization bug - position now set on first frame (cursors.js:64)

Result: Your cursor now follows mouse with ZERO lag!

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Fix cursor lag by throttling WebSocket sends
body:
Before: Sent WebSocket message on EVERY mousemove event (60-144+ msg/sec)
After: Throttled to max 20 messages/sec (one every 50ms)

Changes:
- Local cursor still updates instantly (no throttle)
- WebSocket sends throttled to prevent overwhelming connection
- Moved updateUsername() into throttled block (no need every frame)
- Applied same throttling to touch events

This eliminates lag while keeping cursor movement smooth.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Add local cursor with real-time updates
body:
- Your cursor now appears immediately when you connect
- Cursor updates in real-time on mouse/touch move without server lag
- Server broadcasts ignored for own cursor to prevent conflicts
- initializeMyCursor creates cursor with (you) label on ID receipt
- updateMyCursor handles local position updates instantly

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Fix cursor party: show all cursors with color assignments
body:
Major fixes and improvements:
- Server now broadcasts to all clients including sender
- Server sends client ID on ping for identification
- Added 100 distinct colors for cursor assignments
- Colors assigned based on join order
- Current user's cursor now displays with "(you)" suffix
- All cursors including own cursor hide/show with ESC key
- Current user included in viewer count
- Cursor state consolidated in NgRx store
- cursor.js loads dynamically after app initialization
- Prevents race conditions by waiting for state to be ready

- Make chat placeholder configurable via NgRx state
- Add metadata loading and last-updated component

- Real-time multiplayer cursor tracking
- Cursor chat (press / to activate)

subject: simplify code
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Refine contact section with concentric ripple effect
body:
Updated contact section styling and interaction:
- Changed contact info to clickable links matching app-wide link styles
- Replaced "Say Hi" button with minimalist concentric circles ripple effect
- Reduced spacing throughout section for tighter, cleaner layout
- Updated grid from 3 columns to 2 columns
- Adjusted margins to improve visual hierarchy

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

subject: Update favicon to profile picture and streamline README
body:
- Replace default favicon with profile picture (16x16, 32x32, .ico)
- Update index.html with multi-size favicon references
- Streamline README with concise, minimal documentation
- Add deployment instructions for Vercel

subject: Replace simple about component with comprehensive version
body:
Removed duplicate about component. The comprehensive version includes full employment history, extracurriculars, education sections with collapsible details, replacing the simple 3-paragraph version.
